Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Why does Apple close the apple store?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=266460716

Henry Story wrote:
>
> It's probably not technological reasons at all. Just a way of
> building up interest in the community. It's marketing.
> 

My market differentiation as a Web consultant, is my strong knowledge
of branding (resulting from my 15-year association with one of the top
hired guns in the field, y'all haven't heard of him but you have heard
of "Where's the beef?" and that silly Taco Bell chihuahua).  I don't
sell websites, I sell online branding.  Apple's branding has nothing to
do with inconveniencing the customer; in fact it's the polar opposite.
So I suspect this isn't a marketing ploy, because Apple's too good at,
and protective of, its brand identity of user-friendliness uber alles.

-Eric
